connector.description: Send and receive messages to/from IronMQ an elastic and durable hosted message queue as a service.

camel.sink.path.queueName.name: camel.sink.path.queueName
camel.sink.path.queueName.description: The name of the IronMQ queue

camel.sink.endpoint.client.name: camel.sink.endpoint.client
camel.sink.endpoint.client.description: Reference to a io.iron.ironmq.Client in the Registry.

camel.sink.endpoint.ironMQCloud.name: camel.sink.endpoint.ironMQCloud
camel.sink.endpoint.ironMQCloud.description: IronMq Cloud url. Urls for public clusters: https://mq-aws-us-east-1-1.iron.io (US) and https://mq-aws-eu-west-1-1.iron.io (EU)

camel.sink.endpoint.preserveHeaders.name: camel.sink.endpoint.preserveHeaders
camel.sink.endpoint.preserveHeaders.description: Should message headers be preserved when publishing messages. This will add the Camel headers to the Iron MQ message as a json payload with a header list, and a message body. Useful when Camel is both consumer and producer.

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.visibilityDelay.name: camel.sink.endpoint.visibilityDelay
camel.sink.endpoint.visibilityDelay.description: The item will not be available on the queue until this many seconds have passed. Default is 0 seconds.

camel.component.ironmq.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.component.ironmq.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.ironmq.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.ironmq.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.ironmq.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.ironmq.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.
